content.rendered:
What is a Technical Writer?

Technical Writers use their knowledge of writing form and style to create mainly instructive content like how-to guides, articles, and other documents meant to support technical knowledge.

Where does a Technical Writer work?

  • Technology companies
  • Manufacturing companies
  • Freelancing/self-employed

How much does a Technical Writer make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Technical Writer is $56,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Technical Writers?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • English majors
  • Communications majors
  • Computer science majors
Search Technical Writer jobs on Handshake

Technical Writer skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Technical Writers succeed in their work:

  • Ability to synthesize complex technical information
  • Great teamwork skills
  • Strong writing skills
  • Creativity

What are some common questions about Technical Writers?

Q: How do you become a Technical Writer?

A: With or without a bachelor’s degree, a great way to start your career in technical writing would be to start putting both a resume and a portfolio together. As a writer, your potential employers will always want to know about your past experiences and your style of writing.
